item.title: How we covered the pandemic's impact on traffic in Nebraska
item.description: In March 2020, with campus closed along with businesses statewide, the data journalism class at UNLâ€™s College of Journalism and Mass Communication started talking about how we could measure the impact of quarantine on daily life. To measure the impact of the coronavirus on Nebraska, we looked for automated data collectors. One such automated data collector is the automated traffic counting stations that the data Department of Transportation uses.
